data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_COMMON_HELP_MOREINFO
data.value: For more information about this interactive TUI, visit

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_SCREENSAVERTUI_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the screensaver TUI to preview the screensaver

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_SCREENSAVERTUI_HELP01_BODY
data.value: This interactive TUI allows you to preview a screensaver and save your screen with it, with either a built-in screensaver or a custom screensaver. You can easily choose a screensaver to preview straight from this TUI by selecting a screensaver from the list and pressing ENTER.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_TZTUI_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the time zone TUI for the world clock

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_TZTUI_HELP01_BODY
data.value: This interactive TUI shows you a list of time zones and their local time representations that are refreshed every second. This allows you to use it as a world clock application to look at the time for all time zones.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_TASKMANUI_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the task manager TUI to manage threads

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_TASKMANUI_HELP01_BODY
data.value: The task manager TUI allows you to manage both the Nitrocid kernel threads, which are managed by Nitrocid and its thread manager, and the operating system threads, which are managed by your operating system. You can list all threads and manage them, including the ability to end their tasks.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_TASKMANUI_HELP02_DESC
data.value: Using the task manager TUI to view operating system threads

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_TASKMANUI_HELP02_BODY
data.value: For each managed thread (that is, managed by Nitrocid and its thread manager), the task manager TUI shows you all operating system threads that are related to a managed thread, and they don't always have a one-to-one relationship, because a managed thread may contain more than one operating system thread. Unlike managed threads, they can't be terminated.

data.name: NKS_KERNEL_CONFIGURATION_SETTINGS_APP_TUI_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the settings app TUI to manage kernel settings

data.name: NKS_KERNEL_CONFIGURATION_SETTINGS_APP_TUI_HELP01_BODY
data.value: Kernel configuration is an essential part of Nitrocid that lets you configure parts of the kernel and its components, including the networking stack and the shell stack. This TUI makes it easier for you to configure parts of the kernel, and its intuitive design makes it more convenient than manually editing the configuration file.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_NOTIFICATIONSCLI_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the notifications TUI to manage notifications

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_NOTIFICATIONSCLI_HELP01_BODY
data.value: With this TUI, you can manage all notifications that you haven't read yet. When a notification is received, it's added to the history for future reference, which lasts for the entire kernel session or until you dismiss it. This TUI allows you to easily dismiss and manage notifications, which is easier than using the command-line utility.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_FOLDERS_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the folder group selector TUI to select folders

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_FOLDERS_HELP01_BODY
data.value: A subset of file management TUIs are provided for easier management, which is faster and more convenient than using the command-line utilities to perform the same action. One of the TUIs provided is the folder group selection TUI, which allows you to select multiple folders as targets for the intended operation. If you're brought here, an application has requested you to select a group of folders in order for the operation to complete. You can use the SPACE key to add a folder to the list, then press ESC to confirm your selection.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_FOLDER_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the folder selector TUI to select a folder

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_FOLDER_HELP01_BODY
data.value: A subset of file management TUIs are provided for easier management, which is faster and more convenient than using the command-line utilities to perform the same action. One of the TUIs provided is the folder selection TUI, which allows you to select a folder as a target for the intended operation. If you're brought here, an application has requested you to select a folder in order for the operation to complete. You can use the SPACE key to select a folder, then press ESC to confirm your selection.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_FILES_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the file group selector TUI to select files

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_FILES_HELP01_BODY
data.value: A subset of file management TUIs are provided for easier management, which is faster and more convenient than using the command-line utilities to perform the same action. One of the TUIs provided is the file group selection TUI, which allows you to select multiple files as targets for the intended operation. If you're brought here, an application has requested you to select a group of files in order for the operation to complete. You can use the SPACE key to add a file to the list, then press ESC to confirm your selection.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_FILE_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the file selector TUI to select a file

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_FILE_HELP01_BODY
data.value: A subset of file management TUIs are provided for easier management, which is faster and more convenient than using the command-line utilities to perform the same action. One of the TUIs provided is the file selection TUI, which allows you to select a file as a target for the intended operation. If you're brought here, an application has requested you to select a file in order for the operation to complete. You can use the SPACE key to select a file, then press ESC to confirm your selection.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_SINGLEPANE_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the file selector TUI to manage files with preview

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_SINGLEPANE_HELP01_BODY
data.value: A subset of file management TUIs are provided for easier management, which is faster and more convenient than using the command-line utilities to perform the same action. One of the TUIs provided is the single-pane file management TUI, which allows you to manage your files with the preview of the file in the right pane. This is useful if you want at-a-glance preview pane when you select files or folders.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_DOUBLEPANE_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the file selector TUI to manage files in two panes

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_FMTUI_DOUBLEPANE_HELP01_BODY
data.value: A subset of file management TUIs are provided for easier management, which is faster and more convenient than using the command-line utilities to perform the same action. One of the TUIs provided is the double-pane file management TUI, which allows you to manage your files similar to that of Total Commander. It allows you to quickly perform file operations to either pane, without having to specify paths manually.

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_ALARMTUI_HELP01_DESC
data.value: Using the alarm manager TUI to manage alarms

data.name: NKS_MISC_INTERACTIVES_ALARMTUI_HELP01_BODY
data.value: Managing your alarms is easy with this interactive TUI. This user interface allows you to add and dismiss alarms. The alarms fire when they reach the timeout period, which causes a notification to show.

data.name: NKS_KERNEL_DEBUGGING_TESTING_HELP01_DESC
data.value: How to interactively test kernel components

data.name: NKS_KERNEL_DEBUGGING_TESTING_HELP01_BODY
data.value: You can interactively test all kernel components that are testable here by selecting a test section in the left pane and a test fixture in the right pane. You'll be given a report that indicates that a test has passed or failed.

data.name: NKS_KERNEL_DEBUGGING_TESTING_TESTUNKNOWNERROR
data.value: Unknown error when running a test fixture

data.name: NKS_KERNEL_DEBUGGING_TESTING_TESTFAILED_MATCH
data.value: Expected value doesn't match actual value.

data.name: NKS_SETTINGS_KERNEL_NETWORK_IGNORECERTERRORS_DESC
data.value: If enabled, will ignore certificate errors when making a connection. Otherwise, verifies the server certificate. This should, normally, be not enabled unless you're sure that you're trusting the server.
